sentences: Me arvame, et see on õige vastus.
Nad ei arva, et see töötab.
context: The word 'arvame' is the first-person plural present indicative form of the Estonian verb 'arvama', meaning 'to think', 'to believe', or 'to consider'. It is used when the speaker includes themselves and others in expressing an opinion or belief. In English, this would correspond to 'we think', 'we believe', or 'we consider'.
